page.title: 02AGRICULTURE
page.content:
The major land use is intensively managed grassland used for{dairy {farming.}Situated in the Cheshire Plain this area is characterised by large dairy farms, mainly of freisian herds. Some farms have increased their land area in recent years through the acquistion of neighbouring farmland. The surplus farmhouses and tied accommodation have often been sold and subsequently renovated for private usage, often by commuters to the larger towns and cities outside of this area.
In addition to the large area of dairy farming there are small areas used for the{rotational cropping of {grass, corn and potatoes.}There are also{smallholdings}and areas of {horticultural land. }
